<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Contingencies:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We are a party to various lawsuits, proceedings and claims arising in the ordinary course of business. The
amount of monetary liability, if any, resulting from an adverse result in any of such lawsuits, proceedings and claims in which we are a defendant cannot be determined at this time. However, in the
opinion of management, the aggregate amount of liability under these lawsuits, proceedings and claims will not have a material adverse effect on our consolidated results of operations or financial
condition. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Change of Control:</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our board of directors has approved the extension of certain employee benefits, including salary
continuation to key employees, in the event of a change of control of ADC. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>68</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=68,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=596583,FOLIO='68',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2509]GA2509A.;20',USER='VSTEFAN',CD=';9-JAN-2003;03:23' -->
<A NAME="page_ga2509_1_69"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Note&nbsp;15: Segment Information  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;We have two reportable segments: Broadband Infrastructure and Access, and Integrated Solutions. Broadband Infrastructure and Access products consist of: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>connectivity
devices that provide the physical contact points needed to connect different communications network elements and gain access to communications
system channels; and
<BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>access
and transport systems that provide broadband, multiservice delivery capabilities within service provider networks. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Connectivity
devices assist in the installation, testing, monitoring, accessing, managing, reconfiguring, splitting and multiplexing of communications systems channels within service
providers' serving offices and the last mile/kilometer portion of communications networks. These products include broadband connection and access devices for copper, coaxial cable, fiber, wireless and
broadcast communications networks. Access and transport systems deliver broadband, multiservice communications to consumers and businesses over copper, coaxial cable and fiber networks. Broadband
Infrastructure and Access products are used throughout the world in telephone, cable television, Internet, and wireless communications networks to deliver internet, data, video, and voice services to
businesses and consumers. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Integrated
Solutions products and services consist of systems integration services and operations support systems (OSS) software that aid communications service providers in the
provisioning, delivery and billing of broadband, multiservice communications over wireline and wireless networks. Systems integration services are used to design, equip and build communications
networks and OSS applications that deliver Internet, data, video and voice services to consumers and businesses. OSS software includes communications billing, customer management, network performance
and service-level assurance software used by service providers to operate communications networks. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Our
segments currently reflect changes made in connection with our restructuring initiative. As a result of changes in fiscal 2001, our former Broadband Connectivity and Broadband Access
and Transport segments were consolidated into a single Broadband Infrastructure and Access segment. We made no changes to the reporting of the Integrated Solutions segment. All prior period results
have been restated to reflect these changes. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Accounting
policies used by the segments are the same as those described in Note&nbsp;1 to the Consolidated Financial Statements. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Intersegment
sales were not significant. The following costs are not allocated to segment results: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Non-recurring
and other restructuring-related charges;
<BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Impairment
charges;
<BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Non-cash
stock compensation expenses; and
<BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Goodwill
amortization resulting from acquisitions. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Corporate
assets, which are included in "Unallocated Items," primarily consist of cash and investments, which are managed centrally, and goodwill. Capital expenditures do not include
amounts arising from the purchase of businesses. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Sales
outside of the United States to external customers are determined on a "shipped-to" basis. No single country has property and equipment sufficiently material enough to
warrant disclosure. In fiscal 2002, sales to one customer comprised 10.6% of our net sales. No single customer accounted for more than 10% of net sales in fiscal 2001 or 2000. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>69</FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(1)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$2.8&nbsp;million non-cash stock compensation expense; $3.0&nbsp;million restructuring charges; $1.9&nbsp;million impairment charges; $2.4&nbsp;million
loss related to write-down of investment portfolio; and $7.0&nbsp;million gain on sale of investments. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(2)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$2.6&nbsp;million non-cash stock compensation expense; $57.3&nbsp;million restructuring and in-process research and development charges;
$16.8&nbsp;million impairment charges; non-recurring non-operating gain of $26.2&nbsp;million related to a patent infringement settlement; $0.7&nbsp;million loss related
to the sale of a divested product lines; $19.9&nbsp;million loss related to write-down of investment portfolio; and $24.2&nbsp;million gain on sale of investments. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(3)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$2.5&nbsp;million non-cash stock compensation expense; $33.1&nbsp;million restructuring charges; $160.1&nbsp;million impairment charges; $4.8&nbsp;million
loss related to the sale of a divested product line; $21.6&nbsp;million loss related to the write-down of investment portfolio; $35.3&nbsp;million gain on sale of investments; and
$438.4&nbsp;million charges related to deferred tax asset reserves as well as tax benefit adjustments due to tax law changes. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>71</FONT></P>

<A NAME="page_ga2509_1_72"> </A>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(4)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$2.5&nbsp;million non-cash stock compensation expense; $139.4&nbsp;million restructuring charges; $169.5&nbsp;million impairment charges;
$1.2&nbsp;million loss related to sale of divested product lines; $7.0&nbsp;million loss related to the write-down of investment portfolio; $1.3&nbsp;million gain on sale of
investments; and $1.2&nbsp;million loss related to sale of divested product lines. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(5)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$5.3&nbsp;million net-of-tax, non-cash stock compensation expense and non-recurring charges; $48.9&nbsp;million
net-of-tax restructuring charges; and $5.0&nbsp;million net-of-tax impairment charges. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(6)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$9.5&nbsp;million net-of-tax, non-cash stock compensation expense and non-recurring charges; $76.7&nbsp;million
net-of-tax restructuring charges; $368.8&nbsp;million net-of-tax impairment charges; non-recurring non-operating loss of
$496.5&nbsp;million net-of-tax related to the write-down of the investment portfolio; and $21.4&nbsp;million net-of-tax gain on
investment related activities. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(7)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$5.2&nbsp;million net-of-tax, non-cash stock compensation expense and non-recurring charges; $21.9&nbsp;million
net-of-tax restructuring charges; $4.1&nbsp;million net-of-tax impairment charges; non-recurring non-operating loss of
$16.8&nbsp;million net-of-tax related to the write-down of the investment portfolio; $26.7&nbsp;million net-of-tax gain on investment
related activities; and $3.7&nbsp;million net-of-tax gain on divestiture of product lines. </FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>(8)</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Includes
$10.5&nbsp;million net-of-tax, non-cash stock compensation expense and non-recurring charges; $62.4&nbsp;million
net-of-tax restructuring charges; $(34.3) million net-of-tax impairment charges; non-recurring non-operating loss of
$28.1&nbsp;million net-of-tax related to the write-down of the investment portfolio; $1.8&nbsp;million net-of-tax gain on investment
related activities; and $56.9&nbsp;million net-of-tax loss on divestiture of product lines. </FONT></DD></DL>
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>72</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=7,SEQ=72,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=599939,FOLIO='72',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2509]GA2509A.;20',USER='VSTEFAN',CD=';9-JAN-2003;03:23' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_gc2509_1_73"> </A> </FONT></P>

<!-- TOC_END -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item 9. CHANGES IN AND DISAGREEMENTS WITH ACCOUNTANTS ON ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL DISCLOSURE  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;On May&nbsp;21, 2002, the Board of Directors of ADC, with the unanimous recommendation of the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors, dismissed Arthur
Andersen LLP ("Andersen") as ADC's independent public accountants, effective immediately on that date. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
audit reports of Andersen on the consolidated financial statements of ADC for the fiscal years ended October&nbsp;31, 2001 and 2000, did not contain any adverse opinion or
disclaimer of opinion, nor were they qualified or modified as to uncertainty, audit scope or accounting principles. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;During
ADC's fiscal years ended October&nbsp;31, 2001 and 2000, and through the date of Andersen's dismissal: (a)&nbsp;there were no disagreements with Andersen on any matter of
accounting principle or practice, financial statement disclosure, or auditing scope or procedure which, if not resolved to Andersen's satisfaction, would have caused Andersen to make reference to the
subject matter of such disagreement in connection with Andersen's report on ADC's consolidated financial statements for such years; and (b)&nbsp;there were no reportable events as listed in Item
304(a)(1)(v)&nbsp;of Regulation&nbsp;S-K. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ADC
provided Andersen with a copy of the foregoing disclosures. Attached as Exhibit&nbsp;16-a is a copy of Andersen's letter, dated May&nbsp;22, 2002, stating its
agreement with such statements. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Also
on May&nbsp;21, 2002, the Board of Directors of ADC, with the unanimous recommendation of the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors, appointed Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP as
ADC's independent public accountant for ADC's fiscal year ending October&nbsp;31, 2002, effective immediately. During ADC's fiscal years 2000 and 2001 and through May&nbsp;21, 2002, neither ADC
nor anyone acting on its behalf consulted Ernst&nbsp;&amp; Young LLP with respect to the application of accounting principles to a specified transaction, either completed or proposed, or the type of
audit opinion that might be rendered on ADC's consolidated financial statements, or any other matters or reportable events listed in Item&nbsp;304((a)(2)(ii) of Regulation&nbsp;S-K. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="gc2509_part_iii"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_gc2509_1"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
sections entitled "Election of Directors" and "Section&nbsp;16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance" in our definitive proxy statement for our 2003 Annual Meeting of
Shareowners, which will be filed with the SEC on or before January&nbsp;31, 2003 (the "Proxy Statement"), are incorporated into this Form&nbsp;10-K by reference. </FONT></P>

information set forth under the subcaption "Compensation Committee Report on Executive Compensation," which is not incorporated into this Form&nbsp;10-K). </FONT></P>

reference into this Form&nbsp;10-K. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item 13. CERTAIN RELATIONSHIPS AND RELATED TRANSACTIONS  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The section of the Proxy Statement entitled "Certain Relationships and Related Transactions" is incorporated by reference into this Form&nbsp;10-K. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Item 14. CONTROLS AND PROCEDURES  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Within the 90-day period prior to the filing of this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K, an evaluation was carried out under the
supervision and with the participation of our management, including our Chief Executive Officer ("CEO") and Chief Financial Officer ("CFO"), of the effectiveness of our disclosure controls and
procedures. Disclosure controls and procedures are procedures that are designed with the objective of ensuring that information required to be disclosed in our reports filed under the Securities
Exchange Act of 1934, such as this Form&nbsp;10-K, is recorded, processed, summarized and reported within the time periods specified in the Securities and Exchange Commission's rules and
forms. Based on that evaluation, our CEO and CFO have concluded that our disclosure controls and procedures are effective to satisfy the objectives for which they are intended. Subsequent to the date
of our management's evaluation, there were no significant changes in our internal controls or in other factors that could significantly affect these controls, including any corrective actions with
regard to significant deficiencies and material weaknesses. </FONT></P>

<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=76,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=722218,FOLIO='76',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2509]JA2509A.;9',USER='HRANKIN',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:16' -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_jb2509_1_77"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I, Richard R. Roscitt, the Chairman of the Board, President and Chief Executive Officer of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., certify that: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I
have reviewed this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc.; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
on my knowledge, this Annual Report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made,
in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this Annual Report; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements and other information included in this Annual Report fairly present in all material aspects the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this Annual Report; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
registrant's other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining "disclosure controls and procedures" (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-14 and 15d-14) for the registrant and have: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>designed
such disclosure controls and procedures to ensure that material information related to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is
made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this Annual Report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures as of a date within 90&nbsp;days prior to the filing date of this Annual
Report (the "Evaluation Date"); and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>presented
in this Annual Report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures based on our evaluation as of the
Evaluation Date; </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the board of
directors: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>all
significant deficiencies in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process,
summarize and report financial data and have identified for the registrant's auditors any material weaknesses in internal controls; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal controls; and </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
registrant's other certifying officer and I have indicated in this Annual Report whether there were significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that
could significantly affect internal controls subsequent to the date of our most recent evaluation, including any corrective actions with regard to significant deficiencies and material weaknesses. </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<TABLE WIDTH="100%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
Date: January&nbsp;10, 2003</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="60%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
/s/&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>RICHARD R. ROSCITT</FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="40%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="60%"><HR NOSHADE><FONT SIZE=2> Richard R. Roscitt<BR></FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><I>Chairman of the Board, President and<BR>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>77</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=77,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="1",CHK=1041327,FOLIO='77',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2509]JB2509A.;6',USER='PHENTGE',CD=';8-JAN-2003;23:31' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->

<P><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_jc2509_1_78"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2>
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I, Robert E. Switz, the Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., certify that: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;I
have reviewed this Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc.; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
on my knowledge, this Annual Report does not contain any untrue statement of a material fact or omit to state a material fact necessary to make the statements made,
in light of the circumstances under which such statements were made, not misleading with respect to the period covered by this Annual Report; </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Based
on my knowledge, the financial statements and other information included in this Annual Report fairly present in all material aspects the financial condition,
results of operations and cash flows of the registrant as of, and for, the periods presented in this Annual Report; </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
registrant's other certifying officer and I are responsible for establishing and maintaining "disclosure controls and procedures" (as defined in Exchange Act
Rules&nbsp;13a-14 and 15d-14) for the registrant and have: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>designed
such disclosure controls and procedures to ensure that material information related to the registrant, including its consolidated subsidiaries, is
made known to us by others within those entities, particularly during the period in which this Annual Report is being prepared;
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>evaluated
the effectiveness of the registrant's disclosure controls and procedures as of a date within 90&nbsp;days prior to the filing date of this Annual
Report (the "Evaluation Date"); and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>presented
in this Annual Report our conclusions about the effectiveness of the disclosure controls and procedures based on our evaluation as of the
Evaluation Date; </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
registrant's other certifying officer and I have disclosed, based on our most recent evaluation, to the registrant's auditors and the audit committee of the board of
directors: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>all
significant deficiencies in the design or operation of internal controls which could adversely affect the registrant's ability to record, process,
summarize and report financial data and have identified for the registrant's auditors any material weaknesses in internal controls; and
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>&#149;</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>any
fraud, whether or not material, that involves management or other employees who have a significant role in the registrant's internal controls; and </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;6.&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
registrant's other certifying officer and I have indicated in this Annual Report whether there were significant changes in internal controls or in other factors that
could significantly affect internal controls subsequent to the date of our most recent evaluation, including any corrective actions with regard to significant deficiencies and material weaknesses. </FONT></P>

Exhibit&nbsp;10-jj to ADC's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended October&nbsp;31, 1999.)</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
10-bb</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="88%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
First Amendment to Participation Agreement, dated as of January&nbsp;29, 2001, among ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., Lease Plan North America,&nbsp;Inc., ABN AMRO Bank&nbsp;N.V. and the Participants named on Schedule&nbsp;I thereto. (Incorporated
by reference to Exhibit&nbsp;10-bb to ADC's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended October&nbsp;31, 2001.)</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="10%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
10-cc</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

Second Amendment to Participation Agreement, dated as of August&nbsp;24, 2001, among ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc., Lease Plan North America,&nbsp;Inc., ABN AMRO Bank&nbsp;N.V. and the Participants named on Schedule&nbsp;I thereto. (Incorporated
by reference to Exhibit&nbsp;10-cc to ADC's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended October&nbsp;31, 2001.)</FONT></TD>
</TR>

(Incorporated by reference to Exhibit&nbsp;10-dd to ADC's Annual Report on Form&nbsp;10-K for the fiscal year ended October&nbsp;31, 2001.)</FONT></TD>

securities authorized under such instruments does not exceed 10% of our total assets. We hereby agree to furnish a copy of any of these instruments to the SEC upon request. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kc2539_exhibit_10-d"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kc2539_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10-d    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT> <FONT SIZE=4><B>ADC The Broadband Company&#153;  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=4><B> Management Incentive Plan Document<BR>
Fiscal Year 2003  </B></FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=562597,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KC2539A.;3',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->
<!-- THIS IS THE END OF A COMPOSITION COMPONENT -->
<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="page_ke2539_1_2"> </A> </FONT> <FONT SIZE=2><B>MANAGEMENT INCENTIVE PLAN DOCUMENT<BR>
Fiscal Year 2003  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Plan Name and Effective Date  </B></FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The name of this Plan is the ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. Management Incentive Plan. The plan is effective from November&nbsp;1, 2002 through
October&nbsp;31, 2003. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Purpose  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of the Plan is to provide, with full regard to the protection of shareholder's investments, a direct financial incentive for eligible managers and
individual contributors to make a significant contribution to ADC's established goals. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Eligibility  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligibility for Fiscal Year 2003 is limited to full or part-time regular executives, certain management and higher-level individual contributor
positions. Temporary employees and independent contractors are not eligible for participation in this plan. In order to be eligible, an employee cannot participate in any other ADC incentive plan,
except as approved by the Compensation and Organization Committee of the Board of Directors or the CEO, other than the stock option program and must be employed in an eligible position on or before
October&nbsp;1, 2003. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Timing of Payment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments that become due under this Plan are made as soon as administratively feasible following the close of ADC's fiscal year. In the past, this payment date
has generally occurred in late December. All payments are subject to appropriate withholdings. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Plan Goals  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan reinforces the key goals that support ADC's long-term strategic plans. The key factors in ADC's FY 03 success are net sales and pro forma
operating income. Cash management is also a key factor, and will be primarily driven through these two goals. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;These
goals will be set at the ADC and business unit level. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Following
is a description of the two plan components: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="70%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="23%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Plan Goal<BR> </B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="74%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Definition<BR> </B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="23%"><FONT SIZE=2>Net Sales</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="74%"><FONT SIZE=2>The amount ADC can recognize in accordance with GAAP for goods shipped or services provided to third party customers, net of returns received.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="23%"><FONT SIZE=2>Pro Forma Operating Income</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="74%"><FONT SIZE=2>Net sales less the everyday expenses of doing business. It does not take into account interest income, interest expense, or other income/loss or income tax. It also excludes restructuring and other one-time expenses that
are not reflective of the ongoing business.</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADC/BU Goal Weighting  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employees serving multiple business units have 100% of their incentive plan based on ADC goals and results. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=2,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=583941,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KE2539A.;12',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->
<A NAME="page_ke2539_1_3"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Employees
dedicated to one business unit only have a portion of their incentive based on ADC results and a portion on business unit results as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="71%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="78%" ALIGN="LEFT"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Grade<BR> </B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>ADC Wtg</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>BU Wtg</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Grade 18+</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>50</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>50</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="78%"><FONT SIZE=2>Grades 15-17</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="8%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>30</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="7%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>70</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
individual weighting, refer to the Participant Form. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Individual Performance  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In addition to the business performance goals, an individual performance factor will be applied to the calculation of incentive payments for 2003. The individual
multiplier will be based on the performance ratings as defined in the ADCperform performance management system and will be applied at the time of payment as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="70%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Rating</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Individual Performance Adjustment</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>1 (Top 5-10%)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>Business Performance &times; 1.25 - 1.5</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2 (Middle 80-90%)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>Business Performance &times; .75 - 1.25</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3 (Bottom 5-10%)</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>Business Performance &times; .5 - .75</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Minimum Performance Payment Requirement  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;To ensure protection of shareholder interest, a minimum level of pro forma operating income must be achieved before an incentive payment can be generated.
Specific goals in this respect are contained in the Participant Form. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Calculation of Payment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Prior to making any payment under this Plan, the Board of Directors must determine that the claimed performance levels have been achieved. The Board of Directors
has complete authority and discretion to determine whether performance levels have been achieved, including without limitation the authority and discretion to properly calculate pro forma operating
income. The size of an incentive award will be based on four factors: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Target Incentive Opportunity</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&#151;expressed as a percentage of an individual's FY 2003 eligible base salary earnings.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>FY2003 Eligible Base Salary Earnings</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. This is the amount actually paid to the participant during the fiscal year in Base Salary. Base
Salary for purposes of this Plan includes paid time off (such as vacation, sick pay or PTO), and excludes any salary continuation pay paid through ADC payroll and any disability insurance paid by an
insurer.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Business Performance</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> against the established goals.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>4.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2><B>Individual Performance Multiplier</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>. </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The
minimum individual payment is a total payment of 10% of an employee's target. If incentives earned for all goals total less than 10% of target, no payout will be made. The maximum
award is 300% of target payout. At target business performance and Level 2 individual performance with performance multiplier of 1, the award would be 100% of the stated target percent of Base Salary
Earnings. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>3</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=3,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=588254,FOLIO='3',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KE2539A.;12',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->
<A NAME="page_ke2539_1_4"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;For
the business performance factors, this can be expressed as follows: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="70%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TH WIDTH="31%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Threshold</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="31%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Target</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
<TH WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=1>&nbsp;</FONT></TH>
<TH WIDTH="31%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=1><B>Maximum</B></FONT><HR NOSHADE></TH>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="31%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>0% of Target Incentive Opportunity</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>100% of Target Incentive Opportunity</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="31%" ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>300% of Target Incentive Opportunity</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>There are specific goals established for 0%, 50%, 100%, 150%, 200%, and 300% of target as indicated on the applicable Participant Form. Results between these
specific points are interpolated for each goal.</I></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Here
is an example of a </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>hypothetical</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> award calculation. Refer to the Participant Form for the performance factors and weightings that
apply. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Assume
a Business Unit Plan participant with the following facts: </FONT></P>

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->
<DIV ALIGN="CENTER"><TABLE WIDTH="70%" BORDER=0 CELLSPACING=0 CELLPADDING=0>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Target Opportunity:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>15% of base salary earnings</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Base Salary Earnings:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>70,000</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Performance Rating:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Level 2 with a performance multiplier of 1 applied</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="TOP">
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>ADC Pro Forma Operating Income:</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="49%"><FONT SIZE=2>Minimum level of pro forma operating income achieved</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE></DIV>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

<!-- User-specified TAGGED TABLE -->

</TR>

<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>95%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
<U>Overall Weighted Performance</U></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2><BR>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>

&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="54%"><FONT SIZE=2>ADC Metrics</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>30%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>101.0%</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>30.3%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD WIDTH="2%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="54%"><FONT SIZE=2>Business Unit Metrics</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>70%</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>102.5%</B></FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>71.8%</FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="White" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=2><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="14%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="12%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%"><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;</FONT></TD>
<TD WIDTH="9%" ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><B>102.1%</B></FONT></TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF" VALIGN="BOTTOM">
<TD COLSPAN=8><FONT SIZE=2><BR>
<U>Payment Calculation:</U><BR>
70,000 (base salary) * 15% (incentive target) * 102.1% (business performance) * 1.0 (individual performance factor)&nbsp;=&nbsp;10,721</FONT></TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
<!-- end of user-specified TAGGED TABLE -->


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Effect of Change in Employment Status  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Termination of Employment.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If employment with ADC is terminated for any reason other than death and if the Employment
Termination Date occurs prior to the end of the Fiscal Year, a participant will not receive an award under the Plan. For purposes of this Plan, the "Employment Termination Date" is the date that the
participant ceases to be an employee of ADC (as determined by the company). In the case of termination of employment by ADC, the Employment Termination Date shall be determined without regard to
whether such termination is with or without cause or with or without reasonable notice. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Transfer, Promotion or Demotion to another position with a different ADC incentive plan, target incentive opportunity or business
goals.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A participant, who transfers, is promoted or demoted to </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>4</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=3,SEQ=4,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=260150,FOLIO='4',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KE2539A.;12',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->
<A NAME="page_ke2539_1_5"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>
another position with a different plan, target incentive opportunity or business goals will receive a prorated calculation of payment based upon the number of full months served in each position. The
participant must be in the new position by the first of the month and remain in the position for a full month in order to receive credit for that month under the new plan, target or goals. Full year
earnings will be prorated based on the number of full months eligible under each plan. For example, a participant transferring from Software Systems to Connectivity on June&nbsp;10 would receive
eight months payment under the Software Systems plan (November-June) and four months under Connectivity (July-October). In order to receive payment under the plan during the
plan year, a participant must have completed one full month of service under the plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Death.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If a participant dies during the fiscal year, a pro-rated payment will be made to the participant's
estate. The payment will be based upon the time the participant served in the eligible position during the fiscal year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Administration  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A Management Incentive Plan Committee ("Committee"), appointed and authorized by the Compensation Committee of the Company's Board of Directors, will administer
this Plan. Subject to the complete and full discretion of the Compensation Committee of the Board of Directors, the Committee is authorized to make all decisions as required in administration of the
Plan and to exercise its discretion to define, interpret, construe, apply, approve, administer, withdraw and make any exceptions to the terms of the Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Right to Modify  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;ADC reserves the right to modify or adjust the Plan at any time in its sole discretion either in whole or with respect to a particular business unit. The
Participant explicitly agrees with this modification right of ADC. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Governing Law  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan is made and shall be continued in accordance with the laws of the State of Minnesota, U.S.A. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Severability  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any provision of this Plan shall be held invalid, illegal or unenforceable by a court or tribunal of competent jurisdiction, this Plan shall be deemed
severable and such invalidity, illegality or unenforceability shall not affect any other provision of this Plan which shall be enforced in accordance with the intent of this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Assignment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall have the right to assign this Plan to its successors and assigns and this Plan shall inure to the benefit of and be enforceable by said
successors and assigns. Participant may not assign this Plan or any rights hereunder. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Entire Understanding  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan constitutes the entire understanding between the parties regarding the payment of incentive compensation under this Plan, and it supercedes any and all
prior agreements or understandings, whether oral or written, express or implied, on such subject matter. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>5</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=4,SEQ=5,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=883956,FOLIO='5',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KE2539A.;12',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->
<A NAME="page_ke2539_1_6"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Amendment or Termination of Plan  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall not entitle Participants to any future compensation. The Plan is not an element of the employees' salary or base compensation and shall not be
considered as part of such in the event of severance, redundancy, or resignation. ADC has no obligation to offer incentive plans to Participants in the future. The Participant understands and accepts
that the incentive payments made under the Plan are entirely at the sole discretion of ADC. Specifically, ADC assumes no obligation to the Participant under this Plan with respect to any doctrine or
principle of acquired rights or similar concept. Subject to the provisions of the Plan, ADC may amend or terminate the Plan or discontinue the payment of incentives under the Plan at any time, at its
sole discretion and without advance notice. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>6</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=5,SEQ=6,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="2",CHK=386600,FOLIO='6',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KE2539A.;12',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->

<HEAD>

<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kg2539_exhibit_10-g"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kg2539_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10-g    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>AMENDMENT NO. 1<BR>
TO ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS,&nbsp;INC.<BR>
EXECUTIVE INCENTIVE EXCHANGE PLAN  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Amendment No.&nbsp;1, effective as of November&nbsp;1, 2002, amends the following provisions of the Executive Incentive Exchange Plan of ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. (the
"Exchange Plan"): </FONT></P>

<UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>1.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Article&nbsp;VII
of the Exchange Plan is amended to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Exchanges
made under this Plan will be made following the close of the Plan year on the date that the Committee meets to finalize the MIP awards for such Plan year. Such date shall be referred to as
the "Exchange Date." </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>2.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Article&nbsp;VIII
of the Exchange Plan is amended to read in its entirety as follows: </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>The
effective date of the stock options granted under the Plan will be the Exchange Date. </FONT></P>

</UL>
<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>3.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>Attachment
I to the Exchange Plan is amended by deleting the phrase "last day of Plan Year" wherever it appears and substituting therefor the words "Exchange Date." </FONT></DD></DL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Amendment has been adopted effective as of November&nbsp;1, 2002. </FONT></P>

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.K
<SEQUENCE>5
<FILENAME>a2097401zex-10_k.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.K
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#02STP2509_4">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="ko2539_exhibit_10-k"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_ko2539_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10-K    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADC Special Incentive Plan  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Plan Name and Effective Date  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The name of this plan is the ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc. Special Incentive Plan. The Plan is effective November&nbsp;1, 2002 and is of indefinite
duration. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Purpose  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The purpose of the Plan is to coordinate with the Management Incentive Plan (MIP) to provide a financial incentive and reward to identified participants for
achieving pre-defined business milestones that are crucial for the success of ADC or one of its business segments. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Eligibility for Participation  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Eligibility is very restrictive. It is limited to a relatively small number of employees who are deemed most key to the achievement of crucial business
milestones. Temporary employees and independent contractors are not eligible. Participation requires the prior written approval of the CEO. Participation of a Section&nbsp;16 officer also requires
the approval of the Compensation and Organization Committee of the Board (the "Committee"). </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Milestones  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, one to five milestones will be defined. Each will have an associated date after which achievement is not recognized. For each milestone, one to three
levels of achievement may be defined such that the more difficult level results in a higher payment. Each milestone should be defined in such a fashion that subjectivity is not required to determine
its achievement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Timing of Payment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Payments that become due under this Plan are made on a normal payroll date as soon as administratively feasible following the verification of the achievement. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Payment Levels  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;A payment amount earned through the achievement of a milestone may be prospectively defined as a fixed dollar amount or as a percentage of the participant's
Management Incentive Plan (MIP) annual target incentive. The total of all potential payments earned during the fiscal year will not exceed the fiscal year total target incentive for the individual
under the MIP program. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Eligibility for Payment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In order to receive a payment under this Plan, the participant must be an employee of ADC as of the date that the relevant milestone is deemed to have been
achieved. Participants who leave employment with ADC prior to that date will not be deemed to have earned a payment for that milestone achievement. Participants who transfer to another business or
function within ADC and who have no continuing responsibility in this new role for the milestone achievement will not be eligible for a milestone achievement payment unless that milestone was achieved
prior to the transfer. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Promotions or Demotions  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Promotions or demotions that maintain a responsibility for achievement of the milestone will require a restatement of the individual's payment for milestone
achievement unless the payment amount is expressed in light of MIP target percentages. If expressed as a proportion of the target MIP, an adjustment will be made to maintain the same proportion of the
new target MIP. </FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="4",CHK=534001,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KO2539A.;6',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->
<A NAME="page_ko2539_1_2"> </A>
<BR>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Payment Maximum  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;In no case will payments credited under this Plan during the fiscal year plus any amount paid under the MIP with respect to that same fiscal year combine to equal
more than three times the participant's target MIP award for that fiscal year. By participating in this Plan, the participant expressly agrees to have payments (either under this Plan or the MIP, as
determined by ADC) reduced to conform with this aggregate limit. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Administration  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The CEO, VP of HR, and CFO (the "Management Committee") are jointly appointed and authorized to administer this plan, provided however that all matters effecting
Section&nbsp;16 officers who are participants shall be determined by the Committee. Except as noted in the preceding sentence, the Management Committee is authorized to make all decisions to
administer, apply, interpret, determine whether designated milestones have been achieved and withdraw this Plan, and all decisions of the Management Committee shall be final and binding on all
participants. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Severability  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;If any provision of this Plan shall be held invalid, illegal or unenforceable by a court or tribunal of competent jurisdiction, this Plan shall be deemed
severable and such invalidity, illegality or unenforceability shall not affect any other provision of this Plan which shall be enforced in accordance with the intent of this Plan. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Assignment  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Company shall have the right to assign this Plan to its successors and assigns and this Plan shall inure to the benefit of and be enforceable by said
successors and assigns. Participant may not assign this Plan or any rights hereunder. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Entire Understanding  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;This Plan, together with each participant's individual </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><I>statement of milestones and milestone achievement award
amounts</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> constitutes the entire understanding between the parties regarding the payment of incentive compensation under this Plan, and it supercedes any and all prior agreements
or understandings, whether oral or written, express or implied, on such subject matter. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2><B>Amendment or Termination of Plan  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;The Plan shall not entitle Participants to any future compensation. The Plan is not an element of the employees' salary or base compensation and shall not be
considered as part of such in the event of severance, redundancy, or resignation. ADC has no obligation to offer incentive plans to Participants in the future. The Participant understands and accepts
that the incentive payments made under the Plan are entirely at the sole discretion of ADC. Specifically, ADC assumes no obligation to the Participant under this Plan with respect to any doctrine or
principle of acquired rights or similar concept. Subject to the provisions of the Plan, ADC may amend or terminate the Plan or discontinue the payment of incentives under the Plan at any time, at its
sole discretion and without advance notice. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=2,SEQ=2,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="4",CHK=196539,FOLIO='2',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KO2539A.;6',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->

<DOCUMENT>
<TYPE>EX-10.S
<SEQUENCE>6
<FILENAME>a2097401zex-10_s.htm
<DESCRIPTION>EX-10.S
<TEXT>
<HTML>
<HEAD>

</HEAD>
<BODY BGCOLOR="#FFFFFF" LINK=BLUE  VLINK=PURPLE>
<BR>
<FONT SIZE=3 ><A HREF="#02STP2509_5">QuickLinks</A></FONT>
<font size=3> -- Click here to rapidly navigate through this document</font>
<!-- TOC_END -->
<P ALIGN="RIGHT"><FONT SIZE=2><A
NAME="kq2539_exhibit_10-s"> </A>
<A NAME="toc_kq2539_1"> </A>
<BR></FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Exhibit 10-S    <BR>  </B></FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to Employment Agreement  </B></FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;AGREEMENT by and between </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADC Telecommunications,&nbsp;Inc.,</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> a Minnesota corporation
("</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>ADC</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>" or the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Company</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), and </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Richard R. Roscitt</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2> (the
"</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Executive</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"), dated effective as of November&nbsp;27, 2002. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2><B>Recitals  </B></FONT></P>

<DL compact>
<DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>A.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>ADC
and the Executive are parties to an Employment Agreement dated January&nbsp;28, 2001 (the </FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>"Employment Agreement"</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>).
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>B.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>In
light of the challenging market conditions in which the Company currently operates and other changed circumstances, the Executive and the Compensation Committee of the ADC Board
(the "Compensation Committee") have considered certain amendments to the Employment Agreement. ADC and the Executive now desire to amend certain provisions of the Employment Agreement as set forth in
this Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to the Employment Agreement (this "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>Amendment</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>"). In addition to the terms set forth below, the Executive also requested of
the Committee that he not be considered for an incentive bonus payment for fiscal year 2002 or a base salary increase for fiscal year 2003 in light of the challenging market conditions in which the
Company currently operates.
<BR><BR></FONT></DD><DT style='margin-bottom:-11pt;'><FONT SIZE=2>C.</FONT></DT><DD><FONT SIZE=2>The
terms of this Amendment have been approved by the Compensation Committee, which is comprised solely of independent directors. </FONT></DD></DL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;NOW
THEREFORE, the parties agree as follows: </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;1.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Definitions.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Unless otherwise defined in this Amendment, initially capitalized terms shall have the meanings
assigned to such terms in the Employment Agreement. References to fiscal years are based upon ADC's fiscal year, which ends on October&nbsp;31 of each year. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;2.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3 of Employment Agreement&#151;Compensation.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3(g)(ii)&nbsp;of
the Employment Agreement is hereby amended as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(g)(ii)</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Annual Option Grants.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;3 (g)&nbsp;(ii) provides that at the beginning of each of fiscal
year 2002 and 2003 Executive shall be granted an option to purchase shares of the Company's common stock, which options are to have a Black Scholes value of $5&nbsp;million at the time grant. The
Company has satisfied its obligations regarding annual option grants for fiscal year 2002 and the Executive voluntarily waives this provision with regard to the fiscal year 2003 option grant and also
waives the right to receive the option grant on November&nbsp;1, which would have resulted in a grant of substantially more option shares. For fiscal year 2003, Executive shall instead receive the
following grants: </FONT></P>

<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(A)&nbsp;&nbsp;Executive
shall receive an option to purchase up to 3,000,000 shares of the Company's common stock (the "</FONT><FONT SIZE=2><B>2003 Option</B></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>").
The 2003 Option shall have a per share exercise price equal to the fair market value (as defined in the Plan) on November&nbsp;27, 2002, which shall be the effective date of the annual option grants
to all eligible officers. The 2003 Option will vest over a three (3)&nbsp;year period and shall be subject to the terms and conditions of the ADC Global Stock Incentive Option Plan and an option
agreement entered into by the Executive and the Company, consistent with company practice. The 2003 Option shall be designated as an incentive stock option to the maximum extent permitted by the
Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended, and the remainder shall be designated as non-qualified stock options. The Executive hereby acknowledges that the current Black Scholes value of
the 2003 Option grant is less than the $5&nbsp;million originally contemplated by the Employment Agreement, and that he is voluntarily waiving the difference. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>
<HR NOSHADE>
<!-- ZEQ.=1,SEQ=1,EFW="2097401",CP="ADC TELECOMMUNICATIONS, INC.",DN="5",CHK=535831,FOLIO='blank',FILE='DISK014:[02STP9.02STP2539]KQ2539A.;10',USER='GPEARMO',CD=';9-JAN-2003;01:33' -->
<A NAME="page_kq2539_1_2"> </A>
<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(B)&nbsp;&nbsp;Consistent
with the Company's practice with respect to other selected senior officers, on November&nbsp;27, 2002, the Company shall make a grant of 750,000 restricted
shares of common stock ("Restricted Stock'). The shares of Restricted Stock shall vest in ratable annual installments over a three (3)&nbsp;year period in accordance with a Restricted Stock
Agreement to be entered into by the Executive and the Company. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>Beginning
in Fiscal year 2004 and succeeding years, Executive shall be eligible to participate in all of ADC's regular stock incentive programs. The amount of future awards shall be determined by the
Committee in connection with an annual review of the Executive's total compensation package in accordance with the Committee's practices which takes into account factors including an assessment of the
Executive's performance, the Company's performance and the total compensation paid to similar executives at peer and other companies. </FONT></P>

</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;3.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5 of Employment Agreement&#151;Compensation and Payments Upon Termination.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5(a)
is amended to add new subparagraphs (vi)&nbsp;as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"(vi)&nbsp;all
Company stock options with a grant date after October&nbsp;31, 2002 and all shares of Restricted Stock held by the Executive shall become 100% vested on the date of termination.
Such stock options shall remain exercisable for a period of three (3)&nbsp;years following the date of termination. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;5(b)
is amended to add a new subparagraph (vi)&nbsp;as follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"(vi)&nbsp;all
Company stock options with a grant date after October&nbsp;31, 2002 and all shares of Restricted Stock held by the Executive shall become 100% vested on the date of termination.
Such stock options shall remain exercisable for a period of three (3)&nbsp;years following the date of death or long-term disability. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;4.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;6 of Employment Agreement&#151;Change In Control.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Section&nbsp;6(c)
is amended and restated in its entirety to read a follows: </FONT></P>

<UL>
<UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>"(c)
The Executive's termination would trigger (i)&nbsp;the acceleration of vesting of all Company stock options with a grant date after October&nbsp;31, 2002 held by the Executive and such
options shall remain exercisable for a period of three (3)&nbsp;years following the date of termination; and (ii)&nbsp;the acceleration of vesting of all shares of Company Restricted Stock held by
the Executive. </FONT></P>

</UL>
</UL>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;5.</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;Miscellaneous.</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(a)&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Amendment shall be governed by, and construed in accordance with, the laws of the State of Minnesota, without reference to its conflict of law rules. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(b)&nbsp;&nbsp;The
captions of this Amendment are not part of the provisions hereof and shall have no force or effect. </FONT></P>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(c)&nbsp;&nbsp;All
terms of the Employment Agreement which are not expressly modified in this Amendment shall remain unchanged and in full force and effect. This Amendment may not be
amended or modified except by a written agreement executed by the parties hereto or their respective successors. </FONT></P>


<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;(d)&nbsp;&nbsp;This
Amendment may be executed in several counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, and said counterparts shall constitute but one and the same
instrument. </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>[</FONT><FONT
SIZE=2><I>signature page follows</I></FONT><FONT SIZE=2>] </FONT></P>

<P ALIGN="CENTER"><FONT SIZE=2>2</FONT></P>

<HR NOSHADE>

<A NAME="page_kq2539_1_3"> </A>

<P><FONT SIZE=2>&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;IN
WITNESS WHEREOF, the Executive and the Company have executed this Amendment No.&nbsp;1 to Employment Agreement as of the day and year first above written. </FONT></P>
